OVERVIEW: Typically, Tiagos soils have grayish brown, very friable, noncalcareous A1 horizon 8, brown fine sandy loam B2t horizons having prismatic and subangular blocky structure, ant pale brown, noncalcareous, fine sandy loam C horizons.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-loamy, mixed, superactive Ustic Argicryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Tiagos fine sandy loam - grassland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted,)
A1--0 to 8 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) fine sandy loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; moderate fine granular structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (4 to 10 inches thick)
A3--8 to 12 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 3/3) most; weak medium subangular blocky structure that parts to fine granules; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; neutral (pH 7.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (3 to 5 inches thick)
B2t--12 to 24 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate coarse prismatic structure that parts to coarse subangular blocks; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; peds are hard, friable; wax-like patches on faces of peds; waxlike bridges between sand grains; some glossy coatings in root channels and pores; wax-like coatings on the undersite of rock fragments; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.2); gradual wavy boundary.  (5 to 30 inches thick)
B3--24 to 8 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 4/3) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; peds are hard, very friable; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.2); diffuse wavy boundary.  (3 to 5 inches thick)
C--28 to 60 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 4/3) moist; massive; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; 10 percent gravel; noncalcareous; neutral (pH 7.2).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Jackson County, Colorado; near NE corner Sec. 12, T. 10 N., R. 80 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Mean annual soil temperature is about 42 degrees F., and mean summer soil temperature is about 55 degrees F.  Depth to uniformly calcareous material ranges from 40 to more than 60 inches.  Depth to the base of the argillic horizon ranges from 15 to 50 inches.  ESP ranges from 0 to 15 percent.  Rock fragments range from 0 to 35 percent by volume in a major part of the solum and C horizon above a depth of 50 inches and are mainly 1/4 to 10 inches in diameter.  These soils are dry in some part of the moisture control section for some time in most years.
The A horizon has hue of 5Y through 7.5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 1 through 3.  It is neutral pr mildly alkaline. The B2t horizon ha8 hue of 5Y through 7.5YR, value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of 1 through 6. It is typically sandy loam but averages 8 to 18 percent clay, 5 to 40 percent silt, 50 to 80 percent sand with more than 35 percent fine or coarser sand. This horizon is neutral or mildly alkaline.
The C horizon has hue of 5Y through 7.5YR.  It is typically sandy loam but clay ranges from 5 to 18 percent, silt from 5 to 40 percent, sand from 50 to 80 percent with more than 35 percent fine or coarser sand.  This horizon is neutral or mildly alkaline.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Bassel, Boulder, Burgess, Ethelman, Greenhalgh, and Scriver series.  Basgel soils have continuous horizons of secondary carbonate accumulation and are calcareous above a depth of 40 inches.  Boulder soils have noncontrasting sandy-skeletal substratums above a depth of 40 inches and have more than 15 percent rock fragments throughout the solum.  Burgess and Greenhalgh soils have a lithic contact above a depth of 40 inches.  Ethelman soils have a paralithic contact above a depth of 40 inches.  Scriver soils are mainly slightly and medium acid and have a B2t horizon in which silicate clay is accumulating as lamellae.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Tiagos soils are on alluvial fans, glacial outwash terraces, glacial moraines, eskers, and till plains.  Slopes typically range from 2 to 30 percent.  These soils formed in moderately coarse textured noncalcareous parent sediments derived from a variety of rock sources.  At the type location the average annual precipitation is 15 inches with peak periods of precipitation during the spring and early summer.  The average annual temperature is 38 degrees F. and the average summer temperature is 56 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Gelkie and Parkview soils.  Gelkie soils are fine loamy and have continuous horizons of secondary carbonate accumulation.  Parkview 80118 have more than 35 percent rock fragments, and have a lithic contact at depths of 20 to 40 inches.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; slow to very slow runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used principally as native pastureland.  Principal native vegetation is big sage, bluebunch wheatgrass, pine needlegrass, and sheep fescue.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  High mountain valleys of north-central Colorado.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  OSED scanned by NSSQA and cleaned up by Colorado.  Last revised by state on 10/73.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.

HORIZONS.narrative: B2t--12 to 24 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate coarse prismatic structure that parts to coarse subangular blocks; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; peds are hard, friable; wax-like patches on faces of peds; waxlike bridges between sand grains; some glossy coatings in root channels and pores; wax-like coatings on the undersite of rock fragments; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.2); gradual wavy boundary.  (5 to 30 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: B3
HORIZONS.narrative: B3--24 to 8 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 4/3) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; peds are hard, very friable; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.2); diffuse wavy boundary.  (3 to 5 inches thick)
